result.execSummary:
The defendant Carl G. Derby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug - (if needed) anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**    Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharges.
** Pay extradition costs of $400.00.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Extradition costs in the amount of $400
Amended
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Caspari acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 1 & 2.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 1 & 2.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent on cts 1 and 2 to 15CM781; credit for 84 days served if revoked;; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $400 DNA surcharge; pay extradition costs of $400 (by stipulation of deft); bond applied to costs.
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA C McNeill.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Case remains set for trial.  Atty Caspari requests to adjourn the trial date as the deft has another court hearing on 2/1/16.  Court grants adjournment of JT from 2/1/16 at 8:30am to 2/22/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Caspari's request for substitution of Judge is denied.  JSH set for 1/14/16 at 1:15pm and JS 2/1/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Defendant Carl G. Derby appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Discussion held regarding Commissioner Berman's former representation of the DE; no objections by either parties to proceeding with this hearing. Substitution filed on Br 6, tab pulled for Br 3, however this matter remains in Br 6 as the Judge assigned must decide the substitution due to this case being a co-defendant case. DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over for trial. Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
